metadata.name: Emotional Shell #477
metadata.description:
Manual Dutch Auction (DA): 72 · 54 · 40 · 30 · 24 · 20 every 8 minutes.
Auction will stop changing price when non-reserves are fully minted, and then drop one price tier.

---------

The feeling of being human – with all of its intricate hopes, struggles, and fleeting emotions – seems so unique that we assume artificial intelligence could never replicate our experience. And while we devise systems for solving unfathomably complex problems, generating algorithmic creativity, and unlocking regenerative biological possibilities, we simultaneously cling to the power and originality of emotional feeling – believing it to be the irreplaceable source of what makes us human.

If the body is our shell for emotion and soul, can an artificial humanoid be another vessel for these thoughts and feelings – for human essence itself? If our ‘soul’ is the last stand between us and the machines, what happens when the soul becomes transferable? That we may see answers to these questions looks more real every year, and is perhaps a little frightening. 

Emotional Shell uses introspective portraits of future selves to question what it means to be human, when the people around us are no longer human.

---------

Warning: This piece is GPU intensive, it may not render on lower end devices.

Press 1-3 to select from low, medium, and high quality settings
Press 'S' to save the image at the current scale
Press 'H' to save the image at 2400px resolution

Created with Three.js
For third party license information, please see bundle.js.LICENSE.txt

---------

TENDER x wwatkns
August 2022

metadata.name: Los Osos 2422 #2048
metadata.description:
# Los Osos 2422

I was working on the next EmProps release when accidentally I opened a link to a bear utopic civilization through their existing metaverse. Or should I say "metabears"?

Enter Los Osos 2422. 

Four hundred years into the future bears live in a peaceful civilization heavily inspired by the generative art movement of our times. They are organized in districts that are sustained by bamboo, salmon, berries, and art! Los Osos are black, grizzly, panda, and polar, yet there are no distinctions between species; it's not like they were humans. 

They have different occupations but frequently bears change jobs giving birth to the most eclectic looks.

I took my sketchbook out to capture what I could and started drawing but my presence pissed them off. Ninjas, luchadores, and even a cybearpunk forced me to escape.  Is that a live gummy bear or am I just hungry? The story will continue...

-- 

Los Osos 2422 is a PFP art piece composed of 320 hand-made drawings made as an homage to the nascent generative art current fueled by Tezos blockchain technology in 2022. It features hundreds of references to artists and pieces in several generative and non-generative fields.

The project combines the assets together using a custom open-source algorithm that allows them to stack with the positioning in front and behind the character to create possibilities like shirt collars or hats, dynamic tinting to have hoodies or glasses with different colors, exceptions to give them laser eyes or a green apple in front of the face, complex set-ups to have different versions for some of the outfits, and chance control to allow precise control over the features.

--

Press 'S' on the keyboard to save it as an 1800 x 1800 pixels PNG.

metadata.name: grille : discreet observation #66
metadata.description:
grille
noun.
A grating or screen of metal bars or wires, placed in front of something as protection or to allow ventilation or discreet observation.

Part 2 of 'grille', by pixelwank.
Part 2 is nicknamed 'discreet observation'.

Originally intended as a variation, the idea was posed to split the grille collection up. Part 2 includes less 'clean' outputs with an ethereal mood, as if to look inside... beyond 'protection'.
Intended as a companion piece to part 1 : 'protection' 

In live-mode, click the image or press 's' or 'S' to save a 3000x4000 png

Thanks for collecting ❤
Shoutout Circolors for the support and frenship.

Made with p5js
© pixelwank 2022

metadata.name: Stacked Containers #144
metadata.description:
There is nothing more intriguing than balancing, and balancing things out, when nothing falls through, is a sign that we are thriving and evolving. With this purpose in mind I developed this artwork that balances colors in blocks of various sizes, just like the problems in our lives.

Press S to save as png
August, 2022, Pierre Zamboni

metadata.name: KONSTRUKTS #52
metadata.description:
A study of building and destroying. I built this. You may knock it over.

Humans are both creators and destroyers. One of the earliest games children learn to play is building with blocks, then knocking them down. This simple activity is teaching kids about gravity, cause and effect, and imposing their will on the world around them. As children grow older, the gap between these opposing actions widens. The intention behind knocking things down becomes less innocent, and creators aren't as excited to see their work destroyed.

In 1915, the Russian avant-garde founded the abstract art movement known as Constructivism, rejecting everything except for the absolute purest aspects of form and material. This art was used in service of the Russian revolution and utilized heavily in its propaganda, intended to highlight the utilitarian nature of industrial progress. Mainly, building the new Russia. Its influence is lasting, and can be seen throughout art and design trends even today.

When Russia invaded Ukraine in February of 2022, footage of missiles and airstrikes decimating Ukrainian buildings permeated the media. Ukrainian lives, kitchens, windowsill gardens, and family photos tumbled to the ground. Like children's blocks. Things that took a lifetime to build were destroyed in seconds. 

KONSTRUKTS represents this duality in creation and destruction. Stacked children's blocks are rendered in the style of Constructivist designs like El Lissitzky's Proun series, and Alexander Rodchenko's posters. With a simple tap, blocks (or buildings) can be knocked to the ground.

- Tap anywhere to reveal the KONSTRUKTS menu in the top left. Tap the menu for several options.
- KONSTRUKTS can be exported as USDZ or GLTF models to be used in augmented reality or the metaverse.
- Export a full resolution PNG image from the menu.
- If you knocked over the blocks, you can reset them from the menu.

KONSTRUKTS is built entirely with code, using Three.js, JavaScript, and GLSL.

metadata.name: a manifested realization #7
metadata.description:
In general, this piece continues my study of procedural abstract expressionism. However, I've developed a new small bit of code I am testing here; I am trying to create a "clumping" noise function that looks natural but doesn't have the obvious "look" of Perlin noise, and is more controllable. This piece contains my first public use of this. So it is, in a way, a test. 

I was inspired by the IRL paintings of Francesco D'Adamo, specifically his "Manifesti" series, although (as is the way of things) the end result looks nothing like what I started with, and is a more general 1950s abstract expressionism look. 

This piece is a gift to the collectors of all my recent "a" mints. Thank you all!

metadata.name: 🌱 Potted & Printed #343
metadata.description:
Note:
This token is CPU intensive and may take long to render. 

---

Description:
Potted & Printed is a series of generative potted plants. There are 7 species and they have been selected from my very many indoor plants at home. The species are: 
- Snake Plant
- Monstera Adonsonii
- Alocasia
- Bird's Nest Fern
- False Shamrock
- Ponytail Palm
- Parlor Palm

---

Saving:
To save a 3500x3500 PNG file, double click/tap or press 's' 

---

Made by Sam Tsao (@sam___tsao) with p5.js

Towards the Sea is the name of my first NFT collection
which I sell on the FX Hash site

Using simple lines and simple patterns, I show pictures of the sea
I hope you like them

metadata.name: Beautiful Mind #29
metadata.description:
In the logical completion of tasks, thought, order and action play a very basic, basic and sensitive role if applied in the same way.
For every operation and the most difficult tasks, these three phenomena should be used in the planning stage correctly and logically, so that the task will be completed at the right time and reach the right result.
The creative mind must determine if each of these three phenomena plays its role in the work before initiating any action, especially in basic and infrastructure works (such as social and economic planning or long-term educational and training programs).
Thinking before taking any action is one of the most fundamental underlying issues of taking any action in order to design and plan a logical and reasonable framework.
It is generally understood that thoughts, orders, and actions work together, for example, order only becomes possible when thought about a phenomenon begins, and gradually, the effects become evident.

The purpose of this code is to force minds to be creative.
